How can I suppress the newline after a print statement in Python 3? For example, I have this code snippet:

```python
for item in [1,2,3,4]:
    print(item, " ")
```
The output here puts each item on a new line, but I want to print all items on the same line. What changes do I need to make to achieve this?

In Python 3, the `print` function automatically appends a newline character at the end of each call. To suppress this behavior and print all items on the same line, you can use the `end` parameter of the `print` function to specify a different string to be printed at the end instead of the default newline.

Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this:

```python
for item in [1, 2, 3, 4]:
    print(item, end=" ")
```

In this modified code, `end=" "` specifies that a space should be printed after each item instead of a newline. As a result, all the items will be printed on the same line, separated by spaces.
